name: UISearchBarDelegate
desc: A collection of optional methods that you implement to make a search bar control functional.

items.name: func searchBar(UISearchBar, textDidChange: String)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the user changed the search text.

items.name: func searchBar(UISearchBar, shouldChangeTextIn: NSRange, replacementText: String) -> Bool
items.desc: Ask the delegate if text in a specified range should be replaced with given text.

items.name: func searchBarShouldBeginEditing(UISearchBar) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if editing should begin in the specified search bar.

items.name: func searchBarTextDidBeginEditing(UISearchBar)
items.desc: Tells the delegate when the user begins editing the search text.

items.name: func searchBarShouldEndEditing(UISearchBar) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks the delegate if editing should stop in the specified search bar.

items.name: func searchBarTextDidEndEditing(UISearchBar)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the user finished editing the search text.

items.name: func searchBarBookmarkButtonClicked(UISearchBar)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the bookmark button was tapped.

items.name: func searchBarCancelButtonClicked(UISearchBar)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the cancel button was tapped.

items.name: func searchBarSearchButtonClicked(UISearchBar)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the search button was tapped.

items.name: func searchBarResultsListButtonClicked(UISearchBar)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the search results list button was tapped.

items.name: func searchBar(UISearchBar, selectedScopeButtonIndexDidChange: Int)
items.desc: Tells the delegate that the scope button selection changed.
